thread.title: "Knocked over like dominoes": Four men 'with knives' arrested after car ploughs into queue outside pub 'at 50mph'
thread.title_full: "Knocked over like dominoes": Four men 'with knives' arrested after car ploughs into queue outside pub 'at 50mph'

author: Steve Robson
title: "Knocked over like dominoes": Four men 'with knives' arrested after car ploughs into queue outside pub 'at 50mph'
text:
Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Four men 'with knives ' were arrested after a car 'mounted the pavement' and ploughed into three people 'at 50mph' on a busy London street late last night. 
An eyewitness said the injured - believed to have been queuing outside The Old Queen's Head pub at the time - were "knocked over like dominoes". 
Police chased down the occupants of the car who fled the scene of the crash on foot using the force helicopter. 
One knife was found in the car and one lying nearby, police said - after issuing a statement that they did not believe the incident to be terror related, with tensions running high after Wednesday's terror attack in the capital. 
Four men - aged between 17 and 19 - have since been arrested for offences including GBH with intent and possession of bladed weapons. 
Police and the London Ambulance Service rushed to the scene to reports a car had 'mounted the pavement'. 
The injured - two men and a woman - were rushed to hospital for treatment but their injuries are not thought to be life-threatening. The picture was taken shortly after the incident (Photo: Twitter) 
Eyewitness Ed Griffiths posted on Twitter that the "car collided with a number of people on the pavement". 
Another woman, who did not want to be named, told MailOnline how she was in the queue for the pub when the driver ploughed off the road and 'knocked people over like dominoes'. 
She said: "There were about twenty people in the queue and I was at the back with my friends. A Peugeot car with a smashed windscreen believed to have been involved in the incident (Photo: W8) Medical equipment could be seen lying on the floor near the front of the car (Photo: W8 Media) 
"The car came screeching round the corner at about 50mph and was coming straight for me. 
"I pushed over the barriers and fell to the floor as the car smashed into three people in front of me. They were knocked over like dominoes. 
"Everyone was screaming as the driver then drove off... we all thought it was a terror attack." 
The vehicle involved in the incident is understood to be a Peugeot Partner which was pictured at the scene with a smashed windscreen. The police said people fled the scene by foot after the crash (Photo: W8 Media) 
Emergency services were called to the incident outside the Old Queen's Head pub on Essex Road in Islington at 10.55pm on Saturday night. 
Paramedics treated victims who were lying injured on the pavement. 
One image shared on Twitter claimed to show a knife abandoned at the scene. 
It lay near to the silver car with a badly-damaged front windscreen. 
It comes just days after four people were killed and dozens more injured when terrorist Khalid Masood drove a car at pedestrians then stabbed a policeman in Westminster. 
Britain remains in a state of high alert and police had promised extra patrols in the wake of the atrocity. Police rushed to the scene to reports that a car had 'mounted the pavement' (Photo: @NewsThisSecond/Twitter) 
In a statement, Scotland Yard said: "Police were called at approximately 22:55hrs on Saturday, 25 March to reports of a car in collision with a number of people in Essex Road, N1. 
"Officers and London Ambulance Service attended the scene. 
"Three people - two males and one female - were taken to hospital for treatment to their injuries. At this stage their injuries are not being treated as life threatening. Four people were injured in the incident (Photo: Twitter) Read More Wirral explosion: Massive blast 'injures 15' as at least one building decimated and witnesses report 'war zone' scene 
"The occupants decamped from the car and fled the scene on foot. 
"Four males, aged between 17 and 19, have since been arrested on suspicion of a variety of offences including GBH with intent and possession of points and blades. All four remain in custody. 
"Two knives were recovered at the scene; one inside the car and one found near to the car. 
"Enquiries into the circumstances continue. 
"This is not being treated as terrorist related. 
"Officers from Islington investigate. The National Police Air Service also assisted with the investigation. 
"Road closures remain in place. 
"Anyone with information can contact Islington Police on 101 or call Crimestoppers anonymously on 0800 555 111." Like us on Facebook
